entries.description: List of persons of culinary importance. If no persons are found, return an empty array. Each item must follow the structure below.

canonical_name_original.description: Person’s canonical name as it appears in the source (preserve spelling and diacritics).

canonical_name_modern_english.description: Modern English or standardized form of the name for linkage. If no standardized form exists, repeat the original.

name_variants.description: Additional historical or orthographic variants of the person’s name. Provide both the original and modern English forms for each variant when possible.

name_original.description: Variant name form as found in the source (preserve spelling).

name_modern_english.description: Modern English or standardized form of the variant for linkage; null if not applicable.

gender.description: Person’s gender as indicated or inferable from the source. Use Unknown if not stated or unclear; use Other when not covered by the listed values.

roles.description: Occupational or social roles relevant to culinary history. Select all that apply; use Other if not listed.

items.description: One role value from the controlled list. Use Other if not listed and Unknown when the source does not specify a role.

period.description: Active period or relevant timeframe for the person (e.g., professional activity window).

start_year.description: Earliest relevant year (four-digit Gregorian). Use null if unknown.

end_year.description: Latest relevant year (four-digit Gregorian). Use null if unknown.

notation.description: Human-readable note about the timeframe (e.g., 'fl. 1465–1475'; 'early 17th c.').

associated_places.description: Places connected to the person (e.g., birthplace, residence, court, workplace). Use the standardized place object and specify the association role.

name_original.description: Place name as recorded in the source (preserve spelling).

name_modern_english.description: Modern English place name for linkage (e.g., Milano → Milan).

place_type.description: Best-fitting category for the place. Use Unknown when the source provides no classification.

country_modern.description: Modern country name in English (e.g., Italy; Germany).

association_role.description: Nature of the person–place link. Choose the closest match (e.g., Birthplace; Residence). Use Other if not listed, Unknown if unspecified.

notable_works.description: Key works associated with the person, referenced by label (no identifiers).

title_original.description: Work title as given in the source (preserve spelling).

title_modern_english.description: Modern English or standardized title for linkage; repeat original if no standard form exists.

role.description: Person’s role in relation to the work (e.g., Author; Editor). Free text; keep concise.

contributions.description: 1–2 sentences noting the person’s innovations or historical importance (neutral, factual). Use null if not provided.

social_class.description: Primary social stratum associated with the person, if inferable. Use Unknown when not stated; use Mixed/Other if ambiguous or mixed.

sources.description: Secondary sources supporting the information about this person.

pages.description: Exact page(s) or section (e.g., 'pp. 40–45'; 'ch. 2'); use null if not specified.

quotation.description: Short supporting quote (≤ 500 characters) if the input provides one; otherwise null.

links.description: Lightweight cross-references to related entities using labels (no identifiers).

label_original.description: Exact label of the referenced entity as it appears in the source.

label_modern_english.description: Modern English label for the referenced entity for linkage.

relationship.description: Nature of the relationship to the referenced entity (choose the closest match).

description.description: 1–3 sentences summarizing the person’s culinary-historical significance (neutral, factual). Use null if the input provides no summary.
